results.title: New jig technology
results.creator_credit: Bruce Shearer, Box Hill College of Technical and Further Education and Adrian Harvey
results.brief_description: A program for employees and trainees in the automotive repair industry which looks at the development of two new automotive body repair technologies- dedicated jig systems and universal measuring systems. Both are fully explained and the advantages and disadvantages of each discussed.

results.title: New India's people
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “March of Time”.
Shows the great contrasts of wealth still existing in India. The old feudal rulers still enjoy great wealth. The depressed classes (Untouchables) have new hope but still live in degrading poverty.

results.title: New horizons
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organisation (UNESCO) in Patzcuaro, Mexico, where teachers from twenty Latin-American countries train to combat illiteracy. The students do their field work in twenty nearby communities, co-operating with various UN agencies. UNESCO emphasises that through their own efforts they can create a better life for their community.

UNESCO emphasises that through their own efforts they can create a better life for their community.

results.title: New hearts for old
results.creator_credit: Grant McLean, ONF | NFB and Jean Lenauer
results.brief_description: A report on the work of Montreal’s Institute of Cardiology in the battle against heart disease, dramatically presented in the story of Charlie Harris. As it follows his case from the time he is first stricken by an attack to the conclusion of a delicate heart operation, the film reveals the great progress medical science has made in detecting and moderating the effects of the nation’s number-one killer and in restoring patients to normal activity.

results.title: New Guinea: highland regions
results.brief_description: Shows one of the extensive fertile valleys to be found amoung the mountains in New Guinea and discusses its development under Australian administration. Illustrates activities and conditions in the district, stressing the difficulty and importance of communication.

results.brief_description: Outlines the location and major physical characteristics of Papua New Guinea and illustrates the life and activities of some of the people. Reference is made to developments under Australian guidance.

results.title: New Guinea highway
results.brief_description: Shows the highway which pushes its way for 350 miles from the coast into the highlands, bringing communication to dozens of tribes for the first time. With Bird of Paradise feathers streaming behind him, the ochre-painted “warrior” from the highlands careers down to Goroka on a bicycle for the Highland Agricultural Show.

results.title: New Guinea election story
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Twenty-one years before achieving their independence, New Guineans were able to vote for a transitional form of representative democracy in 1964. Singular logistical problems - of language, and geography - had to be summited, and this film chronicles that process

results.title: New Guinea coffee and cocoa
results.creator_credit: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Peter Whitchurch
results.brief_description: Shows the thriving coffee and cocoa industries of Papua New Guinea. Discusses the use of modern machinery, research stations, and the wide export markets.
